docstring.long_description:
The description of that function is as follows:

    Calculate the relative maxima of 'data'.
docstring.short_description: The ARGRELMAX node is based on a numpy or scipy function.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Array in which to find the relative maxima.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.description: Axis over which to select from 'data'. Default is 0.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
How many points on each side to use for the comparison
to consider "comparator(n, n+x)" to be True.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
How the edges of the vector are treated.
Available options are 'wrap' (wrap around) or 'clip' (treat overflow
as the same as the last (or first) element).
Default 'clip'. See numpy.take.
